intro: Dryandra epimicta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, exhibiting some degree of drought tolerance. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
